page.lettertext:
fol.284r
Belgia. 1591 24 Novem
b
To M
r
Bodly
Belgia: 1591. No
v
By the Contentes of yo
r
wo
r
shippes Lett
rs
of the third
of this monthe received by ou
r
secretarie, we understand
of the estate of our busines there, and althoughe we are
well enformed, and by profe assured of yo
r
good will
towardes us, for the furtheraunce of those our affaires (of
which we will not be unmindefull) we have notwithstanding
thought good to procure these enclosed Lett
rs
unto you, and
hereby once againe to request, that (when the tyme and
occasione shall serve): yt would please you to use yo
r
means
and credyte, that some good resolutione may be procured one
our behalfe from the
States generalle
, for the effecting
whereof, yf you shall need any further instructione, or
matter from us, upon knowlegd thereof, we will
forthewith take order for the same:
and so m o ste hartily
wishing you all good successe and prosperity in yo
r
affaires
we c
o
mend you to God:/ from Middelburch the
24th of November 1591:
Yo
r
wo
r
to c
o
maunde the Deputie associates
and generalitye of the m
r
chauntes adventurers resident at Middelburch: Thomas Ferrers. deputy.
S
r
yt maie please you in acknowlegdment of my thankfulnes
towardes you, to accept of these few lynes with my
service, which I present unto you, yf the same any waye
may stand you in steed:
Yo
r
wo
r
shippes to comaunde J Wheler
